hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Sulaym ibn Jabir al-Hujaymi: I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ with a group from my people. And he said: Welcome to the people without disgrace or regret. They said: We have come to you from a distant land, and between us and you is the tribe of disbelieving Mudar, and we cannot reach you except in the sacred month. Command us with something with which we may inform those behind us and enter Paradise. He commanded them with four things and forbade them from four things...

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Sulaym al-Hujaymi: I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ while he was sitting wrapped in a garment, and the edge of it had fallen upon his feet. I said: Which one of you is Muhammad, or the Messenger of Allah? He pointed to himself with his hand. I said: O Messenger of Allah, I am a man from the desert people and in me is their roughness. So advise me. He said: Do not belittle any act of goodness.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by a man from Bani Abdallah ibn Kaab: The cavalry of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ made a raid upon us, so I came to the Prophet ﷺ while he was dining. He said: Come near and eat. I said: I am fasting. He said: Sit down so that I may narrate to you about fasting. In Affan's narration, he mentioned about prayer and fasting: Allah has relieved the traveler, the pregnant woman, and the nursing woman from fasting. By Allah, the Prophet ﷺ certainly said both or one of them. Woe is me, had I tasted from the food of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Kahmasa al-Hilali: I converted to Islam, so I came to the Prophet ﷺ and informed him of my Islam, then I departed from him. I remained for a year, then came to him again and greeted him. He looked up and then looked down. I said: O Messenger of Allah, it is as if you remember me. He said: Yes, who are you? I said: I am Kahmasa al-Hilali who came to you a year ago, and I have become very thin and my belly has shriveled. He said: What has brought you to this condition which I see? I said: I have not broken my fast during the day nor slept at night since you. He said: Who commanded you to torture yourself like this? Fast the month of patience and one day from every month. I said: O Messenger of Allah, give me more. He said: Two days. I said: O Messenger of Allah, I feel strength. Give me more. He said: Three days from every month.
